intro: Brunia esterhuyseniae, commonly known as the Esterhuysenia brunia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ornamental species.
